item.title: Guess Who’s Still Right 75 Years Later?
item.description: Dale Carnegie, of course. Published in 1936, Carnagie’s book, How to Make Friends and Influence People, remains one of the most important works in interpersonal human relations ever written. I wish I’d been humble enough to read this book when I was younger. Might have saved myself a lot of trouble, reputation, and embarrassment. Here’s an excerpt: Twelve Ways to Win People to Your Way of Thinking 1. **The only way to get the best of an argument is to avoid it.
